item.title: Exception Handling with PHP
item.description: What is Exception Exception is an error condition which change the normal flow of code execution. Exceptions are catchable. That means, we can catch and try to recover or continue with the execution of the program. ‘errors’ vs ‘exceptions’ : Generally errors occur at the language level (ie, the syntax is wrong, missing parenthesis etc) Exceptions in PHP Exceptions were introduced in PHP 5. It is used in an object oriented way.
